text: Caracaraí () is a municipality located in the state of Roraima in Brazil. Its population is 17,746 and its area is , making it the largest municipality in Roraima state. The word caracaraí means "little hawk", a very common bird in the region. The municipality contains the Caracaraí Ecological Station and the Niquiá Ecological Station. Its territory cuts Roraima's in two and keeps boundaries with both the Brazilian state of Amazonas and Venezuela. It is not the only municipality in the state to do so; Caroebe also borders both the state and the country, and has boundaries with Pará too. == References == Category:Populated places established in 1955 Category:Municipalities in Roraima Category:1955 establishments in Brazil
title: Caracaraí
